alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 1:29PM MDT until June 11 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Showers and thunderstorms were falling in the central and southern Bighorn Mountains. The heaviest rain was falling in the North Fork Powder River drainage around Mayoworth. The rain will cause water levels to rise quickly on the tributaries feeding the North Fork and other creeks emerging from the east slopes of the Bighorn Range. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding and flooding of normally dry draws caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Johnson. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry draws. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding and likely rapid river rises on the North Fork Powder River. Minor flooding is likely in the advisory area. Rainfall has been estimated at 1 to 2 inches in one hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mayoworth and Dullknife Reservoir.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
